Data: Kallis to Clarke, no run on off stump and defended to cover
Kallis to Clarke, no run full outside off, Clarke goes for a drive but doesn't time it cleanly
Kallis to Clarke, no run short ball outside off, Clarke lowers his bat and hands out of the line
Kallis to Clarke, no run another full delivery outside off, driven sweetly to mid-off
Kallis to Clarke, 1 run throws his arms through a drive this time, it was very wide and the ball went in the air through cover out to the sweeper
Kallis to Ponting, 1 run jumps back into the crease and nudges this from around off stump to the leg side
Morkel to Ponting, no run and he's bang on target to start, firing one down on a length outside off. Ponting lunges forward to defend

Morkel to Ponting, no run he's knocked him off his feet! Morkel spears in an unexpected full delivery, striking Ponting on the pad and knocking his legs out from underneath him. There's an appeal for lbw, but that was going down leg

Morkel to Ponting, no run another appeal! Again Morkel sprays this a little too far down the leg side, but it touches something on the way through. The South Africans think its glove/bat, but the umpire insists it was only pad. And he's right, by the looks of things

Morkel to Ponting, no run a rising delivery outside off is punched firmly to cover point in typically bellicose style by Ponting, but Duminy scoots across and slides to cut it off cleanly. Duminy has really settled in in that position
Morkel to Ponting, 1 run short of length again, but a little straighter this time and Ponting works a single wide of mid on
Morkel to Clarke, no run Clarke stands at the crease to tap a length delivery back to the bowler
Kallis to Ponting, 1 run chopped down on the off side, just the one
Kallis to Clarke, 1 run a hacked drive played with a horizontal bat flies out to deep cover, where there's protection on the rope
Kallis to Ponting, 1 run pitched full and wide by Kallis, and Ponting eases a drive to cover
Kallis to Clarke, FOUR runs slashed square! Again Clarke had to stretch out to drive but this time played it a little later to pick the gap
Kallis to Clarke, 1 run nurdled into the off side for one
Kallis to Ponting, 1 run this might've been an offcutter from Kallis. It kept a little low and moved in off the pitch, Ponting inside edging an attempted glance onto his pad
Morkel to Ponting, no run Morne roars an appeal! That's highly optimistic, despite the sharp seam movement in off the pitch. It's hit him about a foot outside off

Morkel to Ponting, FOUR runs Ponting dispatches a short ball to long leg with a cracking swivel-pull! That was sweetly timed, it never got up high but bounced just once before crossing the boundary. The old man's still got it ...
Morkel to Ponting, no run Morkel pushes his line a little wider of off, and Ponting steps across to shoulder arms
Morkel to Ponting, 1 wide Morkel's a bit all over the place at the moment. This one is pushed too far down the leg side, and called wide

Morkel to Ponting, FOUR runs in the air! Morkel pitched one up and lured Ponting into a drive. It wasn't quite close enough to him for the shot, however, and he couldn't keep the square drive down, the ball shooting just past a leaping Duminy
Morkel to Ponting, no run Morkel zones in on the top of off, Ponting defends
Morkel to Ponting, no run slapped on the up to extra cover, where a good sliding stop saves runs
Botha to Clarke, no run tossed up on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
Botha to Clarke, no run Clarke is down the track but Botha spots him coming and drags his length back, drawing a defensive stroke from the batsman
Botha to Clarke, 1 run a touch too straight from the offspinner, and Clarke finds the gap at square leg
Botha to Ponting, 1 run quicker and flatter through the air from Botha, but it's dragged down short and Ponting eases a single to leg
Botha to Clarke, 1 run good stuff from Clarke, getting deep in the crease and placing the ball square for another single
Botha to Ponting, no run pushed through flat and aimed right at middle, Ponting getting forward to defend to midwicket

Morkel to Clarke, no run great reflexes from Faf du Plessis! He in close at a short cover point and Clarke absolutely murdered a cut to his left, but Faf thrust both hands out to stop it cleanly. Much appreciated by the bowler
Morkel to Clarke, 1 run worked away for a quiet single
Morkel to Ponting, no run nicely full from Morkel, and the line is good too. Ponting comes forward in defence
Morkel to Ponting, no run yet again Morne is saved by his fielders. He offered plenty of width on the length delivery but the man at extra cover stops the shot
Morkel to Ponting, no run played a little loosely by Ponting, the veteran batsman slicing at a rising delivery to play it to backward point
Morkel to Ponting, no run good end to the over, Morkel aiming at the top of middle and Ponting tapping tamely to mid on
Botha to Clarke, no run a twinklet-toed Clarke greets Botha's first ball after the interval with a quick shuffle down the track, but he doesn't quite get to it
Botha to Clarke, 1 run hurled down quicker and flatter, and after coming down Clarke double-bluffs the bowler by stepping deep into his crease to work a single into the leg side
Botha to Ponting, 5 wide has he got bat on this? Botha gave this one a lot more air but looped it down the leg side, and Ponting just needed a thin glance to get it to the fine leg boundary
Botha to Ponting, no run Botha reverts to type, sending this one down much flatter, and Ponting defends to leg
Botha to Ponting, no run aimed at middle and leg, Ponting turns his wrists over it but can't find the gap
Botha to Ponting, 1 run but this time he does, a single coming through square leg
Botha to Clarke, no run flighted up on off stump, Clarke comes forward in defence
Morkel to Ponting, no run slapped behind square, on the up but straight to the fielder
Morkel to Ponting, no run though his direction has been off, Morkel has hit the seam consistently in this spell and does so once again, jagging one in to Ponting and taking the inside edge
Morkel to Ponting, no run a splice-jarring delivery is pushed to cover. There's pace and bounce for Morkel, as you'd expect, but nothing too dramatic

Morkel to Ponting, 1 run a well played shot for just one run, Ponting stepping confidently forward and driving wide of mid off. Amla sprinted to his left and tumbled into a sliding stop to keep him to just one
Morkel to Clarke, no run rising off a length and nicely straight from the tall fast bowler, Clarke tapping defensively to mid on. Morkel held that one across the seam, looking for extra bounce

Morkel to Clarke, FOUR runs imperious! The bounce in this track is very consistent, and so the batsmen have the confidence to play shots like these. Morkel offered width outside off, but the length was tricky - middling. Clarke made the most of it, however, hammering the ball square of the wicket with his weight forward
Tsotsobe to Clarke, 1 run gives himself a touch of room outside leg then slashes down to third man
Tsotsobe to Ponting, 1 run nearly does Ponting with a slower bounce, it looped off the surface and he had to wait on the shot before pulling to midwicket
Tsotsobe to Clarke, 1 run back of a length, flat-batted back past the bowler put without much timing so mid-off comes round
Tsotsobe to Ponting, 1 run opens the face and pushes into the off side
Tsotsobe to Clarke, SIX runs he's middle that! Dropped in short, Clarke was hanging back waiting for it and latches on with a powerful. He didn't even try to keep it down
Tsotsobe to Clarke, SIX runs and again! He's peppering the leg side, this time it's straighter and more over midwicket as he clears his front leg

Botha to Ponting, OUT backing up, what a way to go! We've seen a few of these of late. Ponting used his feet, drilled it down the pitch where Botha got a hand on it and Clarke was backing up well out of his crease

Botha to Ponting, 1 run almost another run out. Ponting open the face and found third man, Hussey races up the pitch and commits to a full-length dive. Boucher had knocked the bails off before getting the ball, but then uprooted a stump but Hussey was home
Botha to Hussey, no run round the wicket, full on off stump, driven to cover
Botha to Hussey, 1 run back in the crease and work off the stumps to deep square leg
Botha to Ponting, 1 run chips down the pitch and works out to midwicket
Botha to Hussey, no run lovely delivery, beaten by turn and bounce as this spins past the outside edge
Morkel to Ponting, no run driven on the up from off stump straight to cover
Morkel to Ponting, no run down the pitch and aims a heave to leg but loses shape on the shot so doesn't connect
Morkel to Ponting, 1 run length delivery which doesn't really come on to Ponting, he goes for a pull and it lobs towards midwicket
Morkel to Hussey, FOUR runs pinged away. Unlike Ponting, Hussey connects with his pull and it races through square leg
Morkel to Hussey, no run beaten! That had some pace on it. Good comeback from Morkel. Hussey tries to run it down to third man but is done by the bounce
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run fuller and driven square into the off side
Botha to Hussey, 1 run round the wicket, worked off the stumps out to deep midwicket
Botha to Ponting, 1 run down the pitch and thumped to long off
Botha to Hussey, SIX runs brilliant from Hussey, comes down the pitch and outside leg which opens up the off side and he drives it over the deep cover boundary
Botha to Hussey, 1 run fired in quicker, full at the stumps, and tucked out to deep square leg
Botha to Ponting, 1 run backs away to leg but Botha followed him and fired the ball at his feet which meant there was no room to swing the arms
Botha to Hussey, 1 run full again, yorker length and squeezed out to deep cover
Morkel to Hussey, 1 wide down the leg side, no touch on the pad so no escape for the bowler
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run opens the face and plays to cover
Morkel to Ponting, 1 run he's found the non-striker's stumps again, but this time without any touch from the bowler, and it deflects away wide of mid-on for a single...the shot was worth a boundary
Morkel to Hussey, FOUR runs another short ball and Hussey likes them, he managed to control the shot even though it was around head-height and there's no one at long leg
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run goes back to a full length on the stumps, Hussey opens the face to find third man
Morkel to Ponting, 1 run a fairly ugly shot from Ponting as he carves this down to long off
Morkel to Hussey, 1 run delicately glided down to third man using the pace of Morkel
Kallis to Hussey, no run gets past the edge straight away as the ball bounces over Hussey's cut
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run full on middle and leg, nicely timed through midwicket but the fielding is swift to stop a second
Kallis to Ponting, 1 run full at the stumps, whipped down to long on
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run low full toss on off stump, Hussey drives firmly to cover where Morkel gets down well to make a good save
Kallis to Ponting, no run comes down the pitch outside leg then doesn't connect as the ball is outside off stump
Kallis to Ponting, 1 run aims down the ground but it comes off the toe end and lobs into the outfield short of long on
Steyn to Ponting, no run he is on target with the loosener, keeping Ponting quiet with a length delivery on middle and off

Steyn to Ponting, FOUR runs edged to third man! There is a slip in place but this was far too wide for him. Ponting was aiming for a backfoot punch to cover, but Steyn shaped one away from him to take a healthy edge. Unfortunately for him, it flew at a catchable height through the vacant second/third slip area
Steyn to Ponting, 1 run much fuller and straighter, and cutting in off the wicket. Ponting spots the change-up and gets forward to defend to mid on
Steyn to Clarke, no run gentle shape away from the bat again. Tapped down defensively to cover point
Steyn to Clarke, no run Steyn pushes Clarke deep into his crease with a short-of-length delivery that is defended into the off side
Steyn to Clarke, 1 run whipped off the pads, the ball rolling behind square on the leg side
Botha to Clarke, 1 run work off the hip to square leg
Botha to Ponting, no run outside off stump and heaved along the ground to midwicket
Botha to Ponting, no run comes well outside off stump, plays with the spin into the leg side and wanted a single but was sent back by Clarke and had to scurry
Botha to Ponting, FOUR runs lovely shot, a hint of width and Ponting glides it through the vacant slip area down to third man
Botha to Ponting, 2 runs drilled into the leg side wide of long on
Botha to Ponting, FOUR runs connects well with a sweep, takes it from well outside off stump, it goes in the air but clear of any fielders. That takes him to fifty
Steyn to Ponting, 2 runs starts with a good yorker but it's pushed down the ground with just the right amount of force to allow time for a second
Steyn to Ponting, OUT picks out backward point. It was full and wide, Ponting connected quite well but Botha didn't have to move too far to his right
Steyn to Haddin, no run slashes and misses at his first ball, wasn't far away from a wide but Haddin was giving himself room
Steyn to Haddin, 1 run splays his stance to allow himself a free swing then drives a very full delivery down to long off
Steyn to Hussey, 1 run tucked off about middle towards square leg
Steyn to Haddin, 2 runs some excellent timing, again staying leg-side of the ball and drives sweetly through cover leaving long off a chase around the boundary
Kallis to Hussey, FOUR runs this is a super little innings from Hussey as he picks up another boundary over midwicket from a full delivery
Kallis to Hussey, 1 run now he drives firmly through the covers
Kallis to Haddin, 2 runs low full toss at leg stump, pushed down the ground and again with just the right amount of force
Kallis to Haddin, 2 runs this is on a good length so Haddin is able to get slightly under it and swing into the leg side
Kallis to Haddin, 2 runs another full toss which is heaved through midwicket, there's a good piece of fielding on the boundary as JP Duminy brings out the slide
Kallis to Haddin, OUT lofted down to long on, got underneath this too much and it almost went straight up
Steyn to Marsh, 2 runs drives his first delivery firmly down to long where's a fumble so he gets back on strike
Steyn to Marsh, no run excellent yorker outside off stump and Marsh plays over the top
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run low full toss and Marsh swings powerfully through the line to pick out long off
Steyn to Hussey, 1 leg bye well bowled, Hussey shaped to move outside leg and Steyn fired the ball full at his pads and it rebounded down to third man
Steyn to Marsh, FOUR runs connects cleanly through the off side, was short of yorker length and Marsh could drive with a full swing of the arms
Steyn to Marsh, 1 run gets the final ball of the innings down to third man

Australia reached 183 for 4 which isn't a bad effort considering they had to resume from a standing start after 19 overs. Ponting, Clarke and Hussey played well and we'll confirm the D/L adjustment for you shortly. The talk is a target around 220, but nothing official as yet. Been confirmed that the target is 223, makes it a tough
We are just about ready for the chase. Hashim Amla was welcomed to the crease by fireworks to mark his 50th ODI which was nice, but perhaps a little much. Doug Bollinger will bowl the first over
Bollinger to Smith, no run swing straight away as this shapes away from Smith who leaves alone

Bollinger to Smith, FOUR runs back of a length and tucked off the hip into the leg side...oh dear, they end up getting four runs! There was all sorts of pinball played with the fielding and it was Ponting, backing up a poor initial throw, who then gave away the overthrows with a throw past the non-striker's stumps
Bollinger to Smith, no run short delivery but Smith doesn't time his pull as he finds mid-on
Bollinger to Smith, no run tucked to square leg
Bollinger to Kallis, 1 run tight run to start with, pushed into the covers and he would have made it even with a direct hit so well judged
Johnson to Kallis, 1 run hint of swing into Kallis who tucks this off the pads past square leg
Johnson to Amla, no run punched off the back foot into the covers
Johnson to Amla, 1 run pushes at this off the back foot and it comes off a thick edge down to third man
Johnson to Kallis, no run well bowled, nipped back of a length into Kallis who gets an inside edge into his leg
Johnson to Kallis, no run another super delivery, encouraging signs for Johnson as he gets this to swing back late into Kallis and he's taken on the pads but quite high
Johnson to Kallis, 1 wide loses his line down the leg side, that will happen with Johnson
Johnson to Kallis, no run beaten outside off as he drives over a very full delivery...decent opening over from Johnson to keep the pressure on
Bollinger to Amla, no run a solid drive into the off side but can't find the gap
Bollinger to Amla, 1 run banged in short, Amla goes for the pull and it doesn't come out of the middle but it has enough to clear square leg and fall safely
Bollinger to Kallis, SIX runs that's a wonderful shot, picks up a short ball off leg stump and lofts it onto the grass banks behind long leg...all timing that shot, not brute force
Bollinger to Kallis, no run good comeback from Bollinger, responds with a full delivery outside off and Kallis is slightly flat-footed as he plays and misses with a drive
Bollinger to Kallis, no run good pace and line, outside off, which is left alone
Bollinger to Kallis, no run and he beats him again, this time a length delivery that seams past the outside edge with Kallis on the back foot
Johnson to Amla, no run full and searching for the swing, Amla plays it well with a straight bat back to the bowler who parries it to mid-off
Johnson to Amla, no run slung outside off but just inside the markers that the umpires use to judge a wide call
Johnson to Amla, no run that's a ripper! Zips back off a good length and cuts Amla in half as it beats the inside edge
Johnson to Amla, FOUR runs now Amla dishes it out as he launches a full, wide delivery in the air over cover. He threw everything at that
Johnson to Amla, no run more swing for Johnson, comes back into Amla and beats him for pace as he tries to play to leg
Johnson to Amla, no run extra bounce takes Amla on the thigh pad as he jumps into line
Bollinger to Kallis, 1 run back of a length, Kallis just opens the face a touch and plays a controlled shot to third man
Bollinger to Amla, no run full outside off stump, Amla plays a punchy drive which goes straight to a square cover
Bollinger to Amla, no run stays full looking for movement and it's nicely driven up to mid-off
Bollinger to Amla, no run plays from the crease this time into the off side
Bollinger to Amla, no run now he goes short, it's over off stump and beats Amla's attempted to glide it over the slips...it certainly wasn't trying to keep it down
Bollinger to Amla, 1 run pushed into the covers off the back foot and it's a well-judged single
Cummins to Amla, SIX runs and his first ball in ODI cricket is upper cut for six over cover...it wasn't a shocking delivery, but offered enough width for the shot which Amla played with conviction
Cummins to Amla, no run this one is driven sweetly off the back foot straight cover
Cummins to Amla, no run full at off stump, dug out towards the bowler who collects in his follow through
Cummins to Amla, FOUR runs another lovely shot, driven on the up square through the off side. It pierced a small gap between backward point and square cover
Cummins to Amla, no run responds in typical fast-bowler style with a bouncer which follows Amla who, again, tries to go over the slips but doesn't make contact
Cummins to Amla, no run driven up to mid-off
Doherty to Kallis, no run short and wide but he gets away with it as Kallis cuts to point
Doherty to Kallis, 1 run driven down to long off
Doherty to Amla, 1 run pushed through quite flat, Amla opens the face to find the gap at cover
Doherty to Kallis, FOUR runs hammered! Too much width and Kallis unfurls a powerful cover drive that reached the boundary before anyone blinked
Doherty to Kallis, 1 run touch short again, Kallis drives off the back foot to the cover sweeper
Doherty to Amla, 1 run cut backward of square and deep cover does well to keep them to a single
Cummins to Amla, no run back of a length outside off and Amla punches into the off side
Cummins to Amla, 1 run fuller this time, driven firmly towards mid-off but they can still scamper a single
Cummins to Duminy, FOUR runs just gets this slightly too straight, on middle and leg, which allows Duminy a neat clip through square leg
Cummins to du Plessis, FOUR runs that's an emphatic way to get off the mark as he drives a full delivery through straight mid-off, but it doesn't take anything away from a fine over by Cummins
Doherty to Amla, no run cuts square on the off side and it almost carries to point
Doherty to Amla, 1 run plays this neatly off the back foot towards point
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run comes forward and works it past a diving midwicket
Doherty to Amla, 1 run width again to Amla who cuts it out to deep cover
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run onto the front foot, driven through the off side
Doherty to Amla, no run better line on middle and it's defended down the pitch
Marsh to du Plessis, no run starts outside off and it's left alone
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run uses his feet, goes across the crease and little towards the bowler then tucks into the leg side
Marsh to Amla, 2 runs takes advantage of some width and guides it fine of third man but Bollinger slides well
Marsh to Amla, no run chases a wide delivery and is beaten. No footwork and he reached for the ball
Marsh to Miller, 1 run tucks his first ball through square leg
Doherty to Miller, 2 runs squirted off the outer half of the bat, Miller angling the blade as he presses forward to get it to short third man
Doherty to Miller, 1 run swept hard out to deep midwicket, but the fielder is round in time to cut it off
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run chopped down on the off side for one
Doherty to Miller, 1 run looped up on middle and leg, worked off the pads
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run Doherty comes round the wicket to du Plessis, who flicks a very full ball off the toes and down to short fine leg
Doherty to Miller, 1 run speared in flat and full by Doherty, hoping to slip one under the bat. Miller jabs down in time, however, and finds a single to long on
Marsh to Miller, 1 run shovelled off the pads, the ball rolling out to long leg
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run Faf angles his bat to work the ball through backward point
Marsh to Miller, 1 run punched towards mid-off, who is very deep and so a single is on offer
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run worked into the leg side for a single
Marsh to Miller, 1 run Marsh aims for the swinging yorker but it slips out as a full toss that is tapped wide of midwicket
Marsh to du Plessis, 2 runs chipped in the air to wide long on. Deliberately played, the ball falling well short of the fielder
Doherty to Miller, no run drilled hard at mid-off
Doherty to Miller, 1 run threaded through cover for one
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run Faf hops down the wicket but Xavier spots him coming, dragging his length down to draw a hurried defence
Doherty to Miller, 1 run pushed down the ground
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run fetched across to deep midwicket, where there's plenty of cover
Marsh to du Plessis, no run wobbling around off a good length, just outside off. Faf defends down to gully
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run good shot for one run! du Plessis leans forward to slap a drive to deep extra cover
Marsh to Boucher, no run full and straight, driven back to the bowler
Marsh to Boucher, no run a bouncer from Marsh, and though it's not particularly lethal Boucher opts to sway cautiously out of the way
Marsh to Boucher, 1 run a touch straight, and Boucher works him off the pads

Marsh to du Plessis, FOUR runs shot! Faf du Plessis has shown remarkable poise and timing so far in this knock. He uses his feet to good effect, and a powerful drive threads the men at cover and mid-off

Doherty to Boucher, OUT there's an appeal from Doherty as Boucher misses a flick to leg and is hit on the pads, but it's quickly quashed. How close was this? Doherty doesn't look that confident, but Clarke wants to review it. Yep, it pitched in line and would've taken out middle and leg, Boucher is out!
Doherty to Botha, no run solid forward defence first up
Doherty to Botha, no run he sweeps right over the top of one! Botha bent down and tried to smash, but couldn't get anything on it
Doherty to Botha, no run beaten slashing outside off now! Botha thought the cut was on. It wasn't

Doherty to Botha, no run cracking delivery! Doherty is really putting pressure on Botha. This one was slower through the air, gripped on the greasy surface, and spun past the outside edge of his poking bat
Doherty to Botha, 2 runs flicked off the toes to midwicket, and they hurry back for the second
Marsh to du Plessis, 1 run a late cut bounces down to third man

Marsh to Botha, no run another appeal! Marsh nips one in off the seam, as he has done quite a bit on this tour already, and zipped between bat and pad. The Australians thought he got something on it, but it probably touched the back leg. There's no review
Marsh to Botha, no run beaten outside off, on the cut! Botha is taking a while to settle out there
Marsh to Botha, no run full and straight, Botha coming forward with bat and pad together in defence

Marsh to Botha, no run dropped by Cummins at mid on! It was such an easy chance too. Botha was rushed into a pull and the ball popped tamely to mid on. He got there in good time but it hit the palm and popped straight out
Marsh to Botha, 1 run tapped to cover point, on the up, for a quick single
Doherty to Botha, no run Botha uses his feet well to get right to the pitch and smash a drive, but unfortunately for him he hits it straight at the fielder
Doherty to Botha, 1 run and now he's just about swung himself off his feet attempting a mow to leg. He recovers in time to take the single
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run Faf skips down and collects a single to long on

Doherty to Botha, 1 run Botha is living dangerously! He charges the bowler and tries to go over long on, but can't get a good connection. In fact, he hits it so badly that it falls in front of the fielder, saving him
Doherty to du Plessis, FOUR runs a misfield by Smith at deep cover allows four! The ball was driven very hard out into that region, but he just over-ran it
Doherty to du Plessis, 1 run driven down to long off for one
Johnson to du Plessis, 1 wide and he starts with a horrid wide miles outside off
Johnson to Botha, 1 run flapped across the line towards mid on, where the fielder slips on the outfield and allows a single
Johnson to Steyn, no run the bouncer rises up past the grille of the batsman, who sways out of the way
Johnson to Steyn, no run Steyn rides the bounce of another short delivery to defend to point
Johnson to Steyn, 1 run chopped down to third man for one
Johnson to Botha, FOUR runs hammered down the ground! Botha takes South Africa to 99 with a drilled straight drive
Bollinger to Steyn, no run he slams one down short of a good length to start, Steyn tapping to gully
Bollinger to Steyn, 1 leg bye there's a speculative appeal from Bollinger as Steyn is struck on the pad, but this landed well outside leg and the end result is a scampered leg bye
Bollinger to Botha, FOUR runs Botha is starting to middle a few now! But is it too little too late? The ball was short once again, and Botha's pull beat the man at short fine leg
Bollinger to Botha, no run Botha walks right across his stumps and shovels a drive hard at mid on
Bollinger to Botha, FOUR runs straight down the ground! Four more for Botha. This was a quality cricket shot. He picked up the length delivery and lifted it straight back over Bollinger's head
Bollinger to Botha, SIX runs Botha on the attack! More length from Bollinger and it's disappeared over wide long on for six. Do South Africa still have a chance? Rusty and Waleed will say they do!
Johnson to Steyn, no run Steyn doesn't come close to laying bat on ball with a flatfooted swish outside off
Johnson to Steyn, no run Johnson pushes this one slightly wider on the angle across the left-hander, who misses with the cut this time
Johnson to Steyn, FOUR runs Steyn will keep swinging! He has another go and this time finds the middle, flat-batting a length delivery over mid on after clearing the left leg
Johnson to Botha, no run beaten by the bounce as he tries to cut through the off side
Johnson to Botha, 1 run heaves a full delivery into the leg side but can't beat a diving mid-on
Cummins to Tsotsobe, no run short of a length and it's well played as he defends behind the line
Cummins to Tsotsobe, no run that's an excellent short ball, targets Tsotsobe's throat and he does well to play it down in front of gully
Cummins to Tsotsobe, 5 wide that's a quick one but it's too short and climbs clear of the batsman and the keeper
Cummins to Tsotsobe, FOUR runs well done by the No. 11. Cummins followed up with a full delivery but Tsotsobe drove it straight down the ground even though he was quite behind the line
Cummins to Tsotsobe, no run slower ball outside off which is steered into the off side
Cummins to Tsotsobe, no run back of a length, defended towards gully to end a rapid over
Johnson to Morkel, no run full at off stump, hint of shape away to Morkel who drives to cover
Johnson to Morkel, 1 run touch shorter and this time it's nicely punched off the back foot wide of cover
Johnson to Tsotsobe, no run pushed across outside off stump, Tsotsobe stands still and doesn't play a shot
Johnson to Tsotsobe, no run goes full at the stumps and it's driven to cover
Johnson to Tsotsobe, no run short delivery, Tsotsobe drops his hands and lets it go over the stumps

Australia win by 93 runs and that's a very convincing performance. They batted positively either side of a long rain break, especially on the resumption, and benefited from the D/L calculation as they'd only lost one wicket before the rain. The target was tough for South Africa and they needed a good start which never came as Grae
Australia won by 93 runs (D/L method)
Player of the match is Ricky Ponting, AUS
